FuncDef: The move command moves a file within a device. The move command moves a file within a device.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of the source file.
The wildcard "*" cannot be used. The value is a character string in the format of [ <drive> ][ path ] [ <file-name> ]. An absolute path name is a string of 1 to 255 characters. A relative path name is a string of 1 to 128 characters. Up to 8 levels of directories are supported.
An absolute path is in the format of <drive>[ path ][ <file-name> ], and a relative path is in the format of [ path ][ <file-name> ]. That is, a relative path is the root path of the current working path.

Specifies the name of the destination file or directory.
The value is a string of case-sensitive characters in the format of [ <drive> ][ path ][ <file-name>  ]. An absolute path name is a string of 1 to 255 characters. A relative path name is a string of 1 to 128
characters. Up to 8 levels of directories are supported.
An absolute path is in the format of <drive> [ path ][ <file-name>  ], and a relative path is in the format of [ path ][ <file-name>  ]. That is, a relative path is the root path of the current working path.

Examples: Warning: Move file flash:/test/sample.txt to flash:/test.txt? [Y/N]:y
ExtraInfo: You can run the move command to change the path of the current file.
